events.originalText: A homemade bomb partially exploded on an eastbound District line train at Parsons Green tube station in West London, injuring 30 passengers.
events.subtitle: Parsons Green train bombing
events.headline: Homemade bomb explodes on District line train at Parsons Green tube station, injuring 30 passengers

events.originalText: The Belarusian serial killer Ivan Kulesh murdered two saleswomen in Lida.
events.subtitle: Ivan Kulesh
events.headline: Belarusian serial killer Ivan Kulesh murders two saleswomen in Lida

events.originalText: Financial crisis of 2007–2008: The global financial services firm Lehman Brothers filed for bankruptcy while holding over $600 billion in assets, the largest such filing in U.S. history.
events.subtitle: 2007–2008 financial crisis
events.headline: Lehman Brothers files for bankruptcy with over $600 billion in assets

events.originalText: Three armed members of the Croatian National Resistance hijacked Scandinavian Airlines System Flight 130 in an attempt to force the release of those arrested for the assassination of the Yugoslav ambassador the previous year.
events.subtitle: Croatian National Resistance
events.headline: Croatian National Resistance hijacks Scandinavian Airlines System Flight 130

events.originalText: The Ku Klux Klan bombed the 16th Street Baptist Church, an African-American church in Birmingham, Alabama, killing four girls and injuring at least 14 other people (memorial march pictured).
events.subtitle: Ku Klux Klan
events.headline: Ku Klux Klan bombs 16th Street Baptist Church in Birmingham, killing four girls

events.originalText: The scene in The Seven Year Itch of Marilyn Monroe standing in a white dress over a subway grate (pictured) was filmed by Billy Wilder.
events.subtitle: The Seven Year Itch
events.headline: Marilyn Monroe iconic scene filmed in The Seven Year Itch

events.originalText: World War II: The Greek People's Liberation Army won the Battle of Meligalas and began the execution of many prisoners of war and civilians.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Greek People's Liberation Army wins Battle of Meligalas

events.originalText: World War II: American and Australian forces landed on the Japanese-occupied island of Morotai.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: American and Australian forces land on Japanese-occupied island of Morotai

events.originalText: Nazi Germany enacted the Nuremberg Laws, which deprived Jews of their citizenship.
events.subtitle: Nazi Germany
events.headline: Nazi Germany enacts Nuremberg Laws depriving Jews of citizenship

events.originalText: Tanks (example pictured), the "secret weapons" of the British Army during the First World War, were first used in combat at the Battle of Flers–Courcelette in France.
events.subtitle: Tank
events.headline: British Army uses tanks in combat for the first time at Battle of Flers-Courcelette

events.originalText: American Civil War: Confederate forces captured the Union garrison at Harpers Ferry, Virginia, taking more than 12,000 prisoners.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Confederate forces capture Union garrison at Harpers Ferry, taking 12,000 prisoners

events.originalText: The Liverpool and Manchester Railway (L&M), the first locomotive-hauled railway to connect two major cities, opened with the Duke of Wellington in attendance.
events.subtitle: Liverpool and Manchester Railway
events.headline: Liverpool and Manchester Railway opens, connecting two major cities

events.originalText: The Province of Guatemala proclaimed the independence of Central America from the Spanish Empire.
events.subtitle: Act of Independence of Central America
events.headline: Province of Guatemala proclaims independence of Central America from Spanish Empire

events.originalText: HMS Whiting ran aground on the Doom Bar on the coast of Cornwall, England.
events.subtitle: HMS Whiting (1812)
events.headline: HMS Whiting runs aground on Doom Bar in Cornwall

events.originalText: French playwright Olympe de Gouges published the Declaration of the Rights of Woman and of the Female Citizen, hoping to expose the failures of the French Revolution in the recognition of gender equality.
events.subtitle: Olympe de Gouges
events.headline: Olympe de Gouges publishes Declaration of the Rights of Woman and of the Female Citizen

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: British forces made an unopposed amphibious landing at Kips Bay on Manhattan, the American defenders having fled due to artillery fire.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British forces make unopposed landing at Kips Bay on Manhattan

events.originalText: The Ottoman conquest of Lesbos ended upon the surrender of commander Niccolò Gattilusio; the conquering Mehmed II executed 300 Italian soldiers by chopping them in half, claiming he was fulfilling a promise to "spare their heads".
events.subtitle: Ottoman conquest of Lesbos
events.headline: Ottoman conquest of Lesbos ends with execution of 300 Italian soldiers
